abstract: At least 13 people, most of them elderly, have died after eating cantaloupe contaminated with listeria in the deadliest outbreak of food-borne illness in the United States in more than a decade.

headline: Ticketmaster Competitor to Unveil a Web Site
abstract: The Anschutz Entertainment Group will start selling tickets to its concerts through a Web site meant to challenge the industry leader.

headline: Military Rulers Called to Testify in Mubarak Trial
abstract: The judge hearing the criminal trial of Egypt’s former President Hosni Mubarak summoned Field Marshal Mohamed Hussein Tantawi, Gen. Sami Anan and former intelligence chief Omar Suleiman.

headline: Want to Lead? Ask Tennyson and Shakespeare
abstract: To convey management lessons, Enrique Salem, the president and chief executive of Symantec, sometimes turns to the words of classic literature.

headline: Envoy Meets With Leader of Yemen on Accord
abstract: John Brennan told President Ali Abdullah Saleh that the only way to restart American aid would be to sign an accord to effectively remove himself from power.

headline: The Plastic Sandwich Bag Flunks
abstract: Retailers and schools are promoting waste-free options for packing lunch, but parents have been a bit slow to embrace the idea.

headline: Times Names Two Editors to Top Posts
abstract: Sam Sifton, the restaurant critic and former editor of the culture section, will become the national editor. Adam Bryant, who has been a top editor on the national and business desks, will become senior editor for features.
